metadata.title: CVE-2022-29806 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-preview 22.04 LTS (jammy) - high
metadata.description:
ZoneMinder before 1.36.13 allows remote code execution via an invalidlanguage. Ability to create a debug log file at an arbitrary pathnamecontributes to exploitability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-29806` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

zoneminder - 1.36.12+dfsg1-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: zoneminder package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.36.12+dfsg1-1ubuntu0.1~esm1').
